column4: Does anyone have any good alternatives to gnome-terminal  that supports tabs?
konsole?
or apt-cache search terminal :)
oh yeah, also looking for gtk :)
roxterm?
'apt-cache search gtk terminal'
run compiz, then you can have true transparency (right?)
doesn't seem that roxterm supports that.  When I check the transparent bg it just shows my desktop bg
roxterm doesn't need to support it--it's all done in compiz
No,  I don't want to make the entire window semi-transparent... just the terminal portion
ohh
oh well, wait for clutter to become something :P
if compiz had a way to make only a certain portion of a window transparent that would be cool, though I doubt that's possible :-)
clutter?
I think it's just a matter of not-yet-written code
3d effects for apps (not just wms)
I'm intrigued by this clutter thing you speak of.  url?
www.letmegooglethatforyou.com/?q=clutter
haha,  I guess I assumed a search for clutter would turn up results about the usual use of the word ;-)    my bad
oh.  I just guessed :P
me too :D
